name: redream
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to dream about something again, for a second, third, etc. time: Redreaming an unhappy past can free the mind for what's happening in the present moment.
to imagine something again in a new way, or to form a new image or idea of it: We tried to re-dream the film version and create something that made sense for the stage.
More examplesFewer examplesIt's like a dream being re-dreamt, where the basics are the same, but the details vary.The dance doesn't stick to the plot of the book - it redreams it.On the detailed set, the streets of Paris look fabulous redreamed in miniature.
